intro: Diplostephium cochense, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its latex sap contains milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Diplostephium.
